verses.text: Belshazzar the king made a great feast to a thousand of his lords , and drank wine before the thousand.

Belshazzar , whiles he tasted the wine , commanded to bring the golden and silver vessels which his father Nebuchadnezzar had taken out of the temple which \add was\add* in Jerusalem ; that the king , and his princes , his wives , and his concubines , might drink therein.\f + \fr 5.2 \ft father: or, grandfather\f*\f + \fr 5.2 \ft taken: Chaldee, brought forth\f*

Then they brought the golden vessels that were taken out of the temple of the house of God which \add was\add* at Jerusalem ; and the king , and his princes , his wives , and his concubines , drank in them.
They drank wine , and praised the gods of gold , and of silver , of brass , of iron , of wood , and of stone. \p
¶ In the same hour came forth fingers of a man’s hand , and wrote over against the candlestick upon the plaister of the wall of the king’s palace : and the king saw the part of the hand that wrote.

Then the king’s countenance was changed , and his thoughts troubled him, so that the joints of his loins were loosed , and his knees smote one against another.\f + \fr 5.6 \ft countenance: Chaldee, brightnesses\f*\f + \fr 5.6 \ft was changed: Chaldee, changed it\f*\f + \fr 5.6 \ft joints: or, girdles: Chaldee, bindings, or, knots\f*

The king cried aloud to bring in the astrologers , the Chaldeans , and the soothsayers. \add And\add* the king spake , and said to the wise \add men\add* of Babylon , Whosoever shall read this writing , and shew me the interpretation thereof, shall be clothed with scarlet , and \add have\add* a chain of gold about his neck , and shall be the third ruler in the kingdom.\f + \fr 5.7 \ft aloud: Chaldee, with might\f*\f + \fr 5.7 \ft scarlet: or, purple\f*
Then came in all the king’s wise \add men:\add* but they could not read the writing , nor make known to the king the interpretation thereof.
Then was king Belshazzar greatly troubled , and his countenance was changed in him , and his lords were astonied.\f + \fr 5.9 \ft countenance: Chaldee, brightnesses\f* \p

¶ \add Now\add* the queen , by reason of the words of the king and his lords , came into the banquet house : \add and\add* the queen spake and said , O king , live for ever : let not thy thoughts trouble thee, nor let thy countenance be changed :

There is a man in thy kingdom , in whom \add is\add* the spirit of the holy gods ; and in the days of thy father light and understanding and wisdom , like the wisdom of the gods , was found in him; whom the king Nebuchadnezzar thy father , the king , \add I say\add*, thy father , made master of the magicians , astrologers , Chaldeans , \add and\add* soothsayers ;\f + \fr 5.11 \ft father: or, grandfather\f*

Forasmuch as an excellent spirit , and knowledge , and understanding , interpreting of dreams , and shewing of hard sentences , and dissolving of doubts , were found in the same Daniel , whom the king named Belteshazzar : now let Daniel be called , and he will shew the interpretation.\f + \fr 5.12 \ft interpreting: or, of an interpreter\f*\f + \fr 5.12 \ft dissolving: or, of a dissolver\f*\f + \fr 5.12 \ft doubts: Chaldee, knots\f*

Then was Daniel brought in before the king. \add And\add* the king spake and said unto Daniel , \add Art\add* thou that Daniel , which \add art\add* of the children of the captivity of Judah , whom the king my father brought out of Jewry ?\f + \fr 5.13 \ft father: or, grandfather\f*
I have even heard of thee, that the spirit of the gods \add is\add* in thee , and \add that\add* light and understanding and excellent wisdom is found in thee.

And now the wise \add men\add*, the astrologers , have been brought in before me, that they should read this writing , and make known unto me the interpretation thereof: but they could not shew the interpretation of the thing :

And I have heard of thee , that thou canst make interpretations , and dissolve doubts : now if thou canst read the writing , and make known to me the interpretation thereof, thou shalt be clothed with scarlet , and \add have\add* a chain of gold about thy neck , and shalt be the third ruler in the kingdom.\f + \fr 5.16 \ft make interpretations: Chaldee, interpret, etc\f* \p

¶ Then Daniel answered and said before the king , Let thy gifts be to thyself, and give thy rewards to another ; yet I will read the writing unto the king , and make known to him the interpretation.\f + \fr 5.17 \ft rewards: or, fee\f*
O thou king , the most high God gave Nebuchadnezzar thy father a kingdom , and majesty , and glory , and honour :

And for the majesty that he gave him, all people , nations , and languages , trembled and feared before him : whom he would he slew ; and whom he would he kept alive ; and whom he would he set up ; and whom he would he put down.

But when his heart was lifted up , and his mind hardened in pride , he was deposed from his kingly throne , and they took his glory from him :\f + \fr 5.20 \ft in pride: or, to deal proudly\f*\f + \fr 5.20 \ft deposed: Chaldee, made to come down\f*

And he was driven from the sons of men ; and his heart was made like the beasts , and his dwelling \add was\add* with the wild asses : they fed him with grass like oxen , and his body was wet with the dew of heaven ; till he knew that the most high God ruled in the kingdom of men , and \add that\add* he appointeth over it whomsoever he will.\f + \fr 5.21 \ft his heart…: or, he made his heart equal, etc\f*
And thou his son , O Belshazzar , hast not humbled thine heart , though thou knewest all this ;

But hast lifted up thyself against the Lord of heaven ; and they have brought the vessels of his house before thee, and thou , and thy lords , thy wives , and thy concubines , have drunk wine in them; and thou hast praised the gods of silver , and gold , of brass , iron , wood , and stone , which see not , nor hear , nor know : and the God in whose hand thy breath \add is\add*, and whose \add are\add* all thy ways , hast thou not glorified :
Then was the part of the hand sent from him ; and this writing was written. \p
¶ And this \add is\add* the writing that was written , MENE , MENE , TEKEL , UPHARSIN.
This \add is\add* the interpretation of the thing : MENE ; God hath numbered thy kingdom , and finished it.
TEKEL ; Thou art weighed in the balances , and art found wanting.
PERES ; Thy kingdom is divided , and given to the Medes and Persians.

Then commanded Belshazzar , and they clothed Daniel with scarlet , and \add put\add* a chain of gold about his neck , and made a proclamation concerning him, that he should be the third ruler in the kingdom. \p
¶ In that night was Belshazzar the king of the Chaldeans slain.
And Darius the Median took the kingdom , \add being\add* about threescore and two years old.\f + \fr 5.31 \ft being…: Chaldee, he as the son of, etc\f*\f + \fr 5.31 \ft about: or, now\f*
